meanings.definition: To mate or breed inappropriately or incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The two dogs were mismating, causing confusion among the breeders.
meanings.sent2: The farmer separated the animals to prevent mismating.
meanings.sent3: The cats were mismating so often that the other animals started placing bets on who would be next.
meanings.sent4: The birds in the aviary seemed to be mismating on purpose, creating new hybrid species.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper had to intervene to stop the mismating between the endangered species.

meanings.definition: An instance of mating or breeding inappropriately or incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The zoo had to deal with a mismating that resulted in unexpected offspring.
meanings.sent2: The mismating of the rare birds led to genetic complications.
meanings.sent3: The mismating at the farm was a topic of gossip among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The scientist studied the effects of mismating on the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The mismating of the rabbits caused a stir in the animal shelter.
